perturbation.original_text: Each Terminal Party shall also be responsible for the operation and maintenance of that portion of Segment S beginning at its respective Cable Landing Point and extending to its respective Segment T, on behalf of the Parties and the Purchasers.
perturbation.changed_text: Each Terminal Party may, at its discretion, be responsible for the operation and maintenance of that portion of Segment S beginning at its respective Cable Landing Point and extending to its respective Segment T, on behalf of some Parties and Purchasers.
perturbation.explanation: The original text mandates that each Terminal Party *shall* be responsible for operation and maintenance. The changed text introduces ambiguity by using 'may, at its discretion,' creating a contradiction and uncertainty as to whether this responsibility is compulsory.

perturbation.original_text: The Managing Group shall have the option of reclaiming the capacity assigned to a Party that is in default with any payment required by this Agreement or is in default with any other material obligation under this Agreement, if such default has existed for a period of six (6) months.
perturbation.changed_text: The Managing Group shall not have the option of reclaiming the capacity assigned to a Party regardless of the reasons.
perturbation.explanation: Original text allows reclaiming, new text does not. It adds uncertainty.

perturbation.original_text:
Any notice under this Agreement shall be delivered by hand, first class mail with postage prepaid, facsimile or e-mail and shall be deemed to have been given:

(i)    when delivered if delivered by hand, facsimile or e-mail (with
                 receipt acknowledged); or;
(ii)   at the expiration of ten (10) days (or thirty (30) days, if a
                 notice of termination of this Agreement) from the date of
                 dispatch if delivered by mail.
perturbation.changed_text: Any notice under this Agreement might not be delivered and the sending party does not need to notify the receiving party about this event.
perturbation.explanation: The original text dictates specific methods and timelines for delivering notices. The modified text completely negates this by stating that the notice might not be delivered, introducing uncertainty about effective communication under the contract.
